articles.headline: Verizon Letter on Privacy Stirs Debate
articles.snippet: Analysts and consumer advocates suggest the company may be interested in gathering information to tailor the advertising it displays on cellphone screens.
articles.abstract: Analysts and consumer advocates suggest the company may be interested in gathering information to tailor the advertising it displays on cellphone screens.
articles.lead_paragraph: Verizon Wireless, one of the nation’s largest cellphone carriers, has stirred up controversy with a letter it sent to customers recently telling them that it would begin sharing information from their calling records with its “affiliates, agents and parent companies.”

articles.headline: As Defaults Rise, Washington Worries
articles.snippet: A new report suggests that more Americans could lose their homes and that the housing market’s troubles might persist longer than many analysts have been predicting.
articles.abstract: A new report suggests that more Americans could lose their homes and that the housing market’s troubles might persist longer than many analysts have been predicting.
articles.lead_paragraph: During the summer’s credit crisis, investors concluded that the default rates on subprime mortgages made last year would probably prove to be the highest in the industry’s history.

articles.headline: Fleeing to U.S., Cubans’ First Stop Is Often Mexico
articles.snippet: The new way for Cubans to get north is first to head west in a convoluted route that avoids the U.S. Coast Guard.
articles.abstract: The new way for Cubans to get north is first to head west in a convoluted route that avoids the U.S. Coast Guard.
articles.lead_paragraph: CORTÉS, Cuba — Cubans are migrating to the United States in the greatest numbers in over a decade, and for most of them the new way to get north is first to head west — to Mexico — in a convoluted route that avoids the United States Coast Guard.

articles.headline: In Data for Heart Devices, Parts Are a Blind Spot
articles.snippet: Problems with Medtronic’s implanted heart devices underscore the lack of safety monitoring of such products, as well as a design trend that may make them more prone to failure.
articles.abstract: Problems with Medtronic’s implanted heart devices underscore the lack of safety monitoring of such products, as well as a design trend that may make them more prone to failure.
articles.lead_paragraph: Medtronic’s decision to stop selling a widely used part for implanted heart devices underscores the dearth of safety monitoring of such products, as well as a design trend that may make them increasingly prone to failure, several experts said yesterday.

articles.headline: Gingerly, Romney Seeks Ties to Christian Right
articles.snippet: Grappling with suspicions about his religion, Mitt Romney has tried to signal his kinship with evangelical Christians.
articles.abstract: Grappling with suspicions about his religion, Mitt Romney has tried to signal his kinship with evangelical Christians.
articles.lead_paragraph: He has invoked the Rev. Rick Warren, a popular evangelical author and megachurch pastor. He has quoted Scripture and alluded to the Gideon Bible as favorite late-night reading. And he has cited his belief in Jesus Christ as his personal “savior.”

articles.headline: Treasury Chief Aims to Steady Credit Markets
articles.snippet: Henry M. Paulson Jr. is pushing Wall Street and the mortgage industry to devise solutions to the credit crunch — and is helping to come up with some of them.
articles.abstract: Henry M. Paulson Jr. is pushing Wall Street and the mortgage industry to devise solutions to the credit crunch — and is helping to come up with some of them.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 15 — Two months ago, when credit markets around the world were freezing up in panic over failed mortgages, Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. said that he was confident investors would work things out for themselves.

articles.headline: 3 Major Banks Offer Plan to Calm Debts in Housing
articles.snippet: The plan calls for the banks to create a new financing vehicle to try to reduce the risk of a meltdown by propping up an important part of the debt markets.
articles.abstract: The plan calls for the banks to create a new financing vehicle to try to reduce the risk of a meltdown by propping up an important part of the debt markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: The biggest banks in the United States, with active encouragement from the Treasury Department, unveiled a plan yesterday to keep the housing-related debt crisis from worsening.

articles.headline: Three Share Nobel in Economics for Work on Social Mechanisms
articles.snippet: The Nobel award winners developed mechanism design theory, which helped shape government bond auctions, patent systems and voting procedures.
articles.abstract: The Nobel award winners developed mechanism design theory, which helped shape government bond auctions, patent systems and voting procedures.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Nobel in economic science was awarded to three American economists for creating and developing a sophisticated explanation of the interaction among individuals, markets and institutions.
